programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Massive Dad, Russell Kane and Phil Wang are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: That's What Debt Actually Is, Actually
programme.desc: The comedian discusses a convoluted way of getting rid of an unwanted gift, reimagines a classic game show, and reveals how the diamond industry could be brought to its knees.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The 2018 edition of the series in which teams of amateur racers test out their homemade, gravity-powered soapboxes on obstacle-littered courses in Johannesburg, South Africa. The entrants create vehicles without engines and race downhill in this popular offbeat event.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than Â£1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Intrepid gravity-fuelled Soapbox Racers take on Observatory Hill overlooking Helsinki Harbour. How will they handle the brutal berm, the car wash and the ferocious kickers?.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy takes the kids away to her parents while Lee stays in the house to oversee the building work being done their kitchen, but unfortunately the tradesman he has employed has an annoyingly relaxed attitude to deadlines. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Stand By Me (1986)
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with BBC Breakfast presenter Naga Munchetty and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: As a Protestant, Queen Elizabeth I lived with the threat of assassination from Catholics throughout her reign. Thankfully, there was an army of men available to work in secret under spy master Francis Walsingham with the sole aim of protecting her. As this documentary reveals, Walsingham was able to demonstrate remarkable cunning in his role.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's âLiberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder committed by Ruth Ellis, the last woman to be hanged in Britain whose case divided the nation.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Scottish serial killer Peter Manuel, who murdered at least eight people between 1956 and 1958 in the Greater Glasgow area.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

Meanwhile, Michelle plans to swap an eel containing the Fallen Madonna for a dog fish containing 10 million French francs.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: A look at the secret network behind Queen Elizabeth I's 40-year reign and the world's first secret service run by her spymasters Robert and William Cecil..

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.sub-title: The Men Who Found the Maya
programme.desc: The documentary investigating the stories of explorers who put everything on the line to find sought-after objects returns, beginning with a look at American lawyer John Lloyd Stephens and British artist Frederick Catherwood - the men who found the Maya civilization.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Time Team Guide to Burial
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team revisit ancient burial sites around the country, including Bronze Age cemeteries, Roman mausoleums and decorative Anglo-Saxon resting places to reveal how funeral customs have developed and evolved over thousands of years of British history.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Forgotten Gunners of WW1: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: The team visits Belton House stately home near Grantham, Lincolnshire, to investigate the creation of the Machine Gun Corps during the First World War. The regiment was set up in the grounds, but today there is virtually no sign of its existence and most regimental records have been destroyed. The dig, however, is rich in finds, revealing glimpses of the lives of the thousands of men who trained at the site, many of whom died in battle.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.sub-title: The Secret Viking Grave of Ridgeway Hill
programme.desc: Archaeologists investigate the discovery of a mass grave in Dorset, and try to determine if the bodies are the remains of Vikings.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: The story of the invertebrates that left the sea to move on to land 400 million years ago. Since then, they have become the most successful group of animals, without which the land's ecosystem would collapse. David Attenborough examines the insects' behaviour, travelling to South Africa and Venezuela to witness the habits and routines of millipedes and centipedes.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Past
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of Thomas Beale's Treasure
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting the search for treasures believed to have been buried by Thomas Beale in Colorado's Blue Ridge Mountains, and the mission by brothers Clayton and George Hart in 1897 to crack the ciphers left by Beale that allegedly reveal the location of the hoard. However, the siblings never solved the code, and a century later many question whether the story of Beale's treasure is just an elaborate hoax.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team explore a site at Brancaster in Norfolk that is believed to have been a Roman 'shore fort', and possibly a key military outpost. They amass 2,500 finds - their biggest-ever haul - which provide information on contemporary decorative arts, sport and much more, and also undertake a high-definition geophysics survey that generates enough data to crash the computers. The biggest surprise reveals evidence of a high level of trade with the local population, and clues as to how Britons living near the site benefited financially from the Roman presence.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate an Iron Age hill fort in Cardiff that dominates a city housing estate, and explore whether the site could be the long-lost ancient capital of south Wales. With five acres of ground and half a mile of ramparts and ditches to examine, time is not on their side, but, helped by the local community, finds such as the remains of jewellery and drinking vessels help paint a vivid picture of domestic life around 800BC.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough tells the tale of winged insects, witnessing mayflies emerging from their larval cases in central Hungary and purple crow butterflies in the valleys of Taiwan. Slow-motion cameras reveal the incredible flight skills that enable the creatures to find new territories and sources of food. The aeronautical tricks employed by heavier insects such as bees and beetles are also revealed.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians help Hektor Rous, the son of 'Aussie Earl' Keith Rous, piece together the mysterious history of the family's Tudor country home in Suffolk. In 2004, he moved from Melbourne, Australia, hoping to rebuild the estate's fortunes, and established events such as the Latitude Festival in its 3,500-acre grounds.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his team head to an army training ground on Salisbury Plain to discover what lies beneath the Barrow Clump, a huge mound of earth built by Bronze Age people to bury their dead. More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. The team is joined for the dig by a group of wounded soldiers whose members are being trained in archaeology as part of their rehabilitation.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The daring engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador.

More than 2,500 years later, the Anglo-Saxons re-used the location as a burial site, leaving behind some fascinating artefacts. programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: How a well-preserved Viking ship discovered in 1904 continues to present archaeologists with new mysteries to unravel.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Lake District to look for copper, a forgotten piece of the nation's industrial heritage. There are nearly two dozen old mines across the mountains, some thought to have been established 400 years ago when the valleys would have been studded with workshops, scaffolding and water-powered machines, home to a brave band of Tudor miners. The team battles the rain, wind and dangerously unstable trackways, but the combination of sheer effort and hi-tech kit enables the experts to access the heart of an old mine.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team heads to the small county of Rutland to visit Oakham Castle, the most well-preserved 12th-century building in Britain. It was once home to the Norman knight Walkelin de Ferrers, who fought alongside Richard the Lionheart in the Crusades, and before that the residence of several Saxon kings and queens. Tony and the crew investigate de Ferrers' long-lost private quarters, but it takes three days of twists and turns to determine what the site looked like 900 years ago. To mark the visit, they also cast a giant Time Team horseshoe to add to the collection that has decorated the castle hall for half a millennium.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to the network of partnerships that invertebrates have developed with one another and with plants. He reveals how the fairy wasp, the world's smallest insect, flies underwater to inject its eggs into those of the water beetle. Footage also shows how the caterpillar of the blue butterfly smuggles its way into an ants' nest by mimicking the smell of their young.

programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts head to a field in south Oxfordshire where significant findings were made by an inquisitive PhD student half a century ago, including a mosaic and the stone walls of a former Roman building. Tony Robinson and the crew examine aerial pictures showing clear building lines in the ground, and speak to the current landowner, a farmer who continues to uncover bricks and tiles. They try to evaluate the building's purpose and how the Thames may have shifted the remains over the course of two millennia.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores how insects compensate for their small size by banding together in vast numbers. He reveals that the operations of many of these societies are so finely tuned they appear to work as a single entity. Footage shows how African termite mounds act as huge ventilation systems of such sophistication that humans are only now beginning to unravel the mechanics of the structure.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever thought possible, including technology that allows trains to navigate the winding mountains of Spain at speed.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: A selection of archive footage from the arrival of the so-called beat boom in 1964, which catered to the art-school craze for rhythm and blues. Featuring performances by Tom Jones, the Kinks, Manfred Mann, the Rolling Stones, John Lee Hooker and the Pretty Things.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen.

programme.desc: Music from the Top of the Pops archives, featuring performances by acts including the Foundations, Procol Harum, the Bee Gees, the Rolling Stones, and Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah arrives in Paris, hoping to reconnect with her husband, and is shocked by what she finds. Elizabeth pushes George to be truthful, but causes more damage to their already fragile relationship. Regina puts the next stage of her plan into action, and while Anna finds out the truth about her real father, Olivia proves the depths she is prepared to go to in order to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah returns to Inverness with Rene, but may have underestimated her feelings for George. Olivia finds the burden of deception weighs heavily, while Anna and Gino prepare for their wedding day.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Rene suspects he is standing in the way of Sarah's happiness after witnessing a moment of yearning, while Andrew disturbs Anna and Gino's honeymoon bliss. Elsewhere, George makes an announcement.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. While in Venice investigating his friend's death, Lovejoy discovers that not only is the beautiful Caterina saving art for herself rather than posterity, but so too is her sister Lavinia. Fulton Mackay, Gwen Humble and Haydn Gwynne guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Struggling to come to terms with Conor's revelation about his sexuality, Sheelagh tries to build bridges with him - only to be floored by another shocking discovery. Irene Radford is implicated in an arson attack on an ice cream van, but it seems she will escape justice yet again when the van owner dies in suspicious circumstances. Jack angrily dismisses Debbie's concerns about his relationship with Rachel, but she refuses to take a hint and arranges a set-up to catch her out.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Rob and Ken set out on the trail of warring factions the Hambilton Massive and Copthorne Crew, Kerry accepts a risky undercover assignment in a bid to help them nail local crime family the Radfords. Ramani returns to CSU and is appalled by the way Phil Hunter has handled things in her absence, while Rachel exacts a violent revenge on Martin Grainger, convinced he was responsible for telling Jack about her continuing involvement in the vice trade.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Snows battle on with life, knowing it will never be the same again without Peggy, but at least a little light relief is on the horizon in the form of the school production of The Wizard of Oz. Meanwhile, Dick and Cheryl finally get through to adopted son Oscar, who has been more of a handful than they ever expected. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Henry and Jess' meal together proves productive, Simon and Anna go out on a date and Karen worries about an elderly patient's grand-daughter. Drama about community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: With the advent of a mass X-ray programme to diagnose tuberculosis early, Dr Turner is determined that Poplar will no longer live under the threat of the disease. Meanwhile, Jenny's district nursing rounds lead her to the Mastersons, who suffered devastating misfortune from TB, and she works to reconcile the dying father with his only remaining daughter, Julia. Having succeeded in securing a visit from a screening van, Dr Turner and the midwives endure a busy day, but little can prepare them for what the results will mean for one of their own. Guest starring Karl Johnson (Lark Rise to Candleford).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia's district nursing rounds find her tending a diabetic man who turns out to be a terrible bully to his wife, while Jenny looks after a black mother-to-be being subjected to racial prejudice from her neighbours. Nonnatus House prepares for the return of Chummy from Sierra Leone - but she has her own surprise. Miranda Hart, Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: There's a buzz of excitement at Nonnatus House as Chummy and Peter prepare for the arrival of their baby, Fred has a visit from his pregnant daughter and Jenny's love life is looking up when she is introduced to a potential new gentleman friend. However, change is in the air in Poplar and soon the friends are forced to stand together as their home comes under threat. Jessica Raine, Miranda Hart, Cliff Parisi, Ben Caplan and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The maverick detective finds his career on the line once more when an apparently watertight murder prosecution collapses because of his unconventional interrogation methods. Facing the wrath of the victim's family - not to mention his own colleagues - Rebus digs deeper, but finds himself caught up in a spate of gangland revenge killings. Nicholas Farrell guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Rumours start to circulate about Colonel Hammond's love life, and the fusiliers suspect his loyalties will be compromised by his new love.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Bernie Roberts looks to be the guilty party when she is involved in a road accident. Meanwhile, Kieron Voce faces criticism from senior officers.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie feels Will's bedside manner needs improving and makes it clear she has no respect for his privileged upbringing. She orders him to go out for a drink with her and discovers a few surprising secrets about his background. Diane returns to work for the first time since her sister's death, but some of her colleagues think she hasn't given herself enough time to deal with the grief, or taking on the responsibility of raising Joanna's child. When she breaks down during the shift, it becomes clear she blames herself for the tragedy.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is horrified to discover her daughter Abi is involved with a local criminal whose activities are currently the focus of a Sun Hill investigation. Behind the scenes, Gina Gold offers June and Jim the chance of a lavish all-expenses-paid reception as they prepare for their impending wedding - while a beetle-browed Gabriel Kent glowers menacingly in the background.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June and Jim prepare to tie the knot, the past threatens to catch up with both of them and shatter their happiness. Evil Gabriel plays mind games with the pair, suggesting the marriage is merely a sham, while Jim's drunken ex-wife Marie makes an unscheduled appearance - but will love conquer all? The romance of the occasion goes to Reg and Marilyn's heads, while back at the station, Adam gets lured into a trap that could destroy his career.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Etta and Pauline receive a phone call from the Portsmouth police to be told that Michelle and Clyde have been caught, and Vicki and Kofi are in a children's home there.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Will Mark find Joe? And if he does, will Joe be able to give him any clues about Eddie's murderers?.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry takes advantage when he gets locked in the pub on Christmas night, but then is too scared to go home on Boxing Day. Festive special from 1990, starring Mike Grady, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley faces charges of intimidating a suspect, and is suspended from duty, meaning Havers and new partner DI Fiona Knight (guest star Liza Tarbuck) must investigate when the body of a woman is found in a lake. However, the detective involves himself in the case, compromising his chances of an unbiased trial. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.sub-title: This is Not a Love Song
programme.desc: Hugh and Penny are forced together during an overnight trip to a coal mine, and Meryl turns failure into success when she unveils a new statue to commemorate the town.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave, Paddy, Tony and Luke plan a wild night out in Amsterdam, and Captain Keiron Voce and Kate Butler finally voice their feelings for each other.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers carry out a series of exercises in evacuating casualties from a combat zone, which leaves them convinced they are about to be sent on active duty.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June and Jim prepare to tie the knot, the past threatens to catch up with both of them and shatter their happiness. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Still working undercover, Kerry gets in way over her head after witnessing the death of a Radford escort girl and being ordered to give one of the others a beating, and Rob begins to fear the worst when she goes for days without reporting back. As Neil's relationship with Andrea blossoms, he lets slip some of his most closely guarded secrets about his colleagues - not least big cheese Adam Okaro - which soon end up on the front pages of the newspapers. Gina is distraught to discover Jonathan has requested a transfer to another station.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A mystery man arrives in Albert Square, on the lookout for Mark Fowler.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A businessman in the process of running away with his mistress falls down a lift shaft, suffering severe injuries to his spine. Daniel returns to work following his breakdown and confesses to colleagues his heart is no longer in the job, while Baz accepts Charlie's invitation to supper.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.sub-title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo Clock
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2005. The south Londoners' dreams of joining the country set come one step closer when they attend the Royal Agricultural Ball, where they are introduced to titled gentry Rupert and Jonty, who tempt Boycie to invest in a new polo club - and things get even better when they're invited to spend Christmas in St Moritz to finalise the deal. However, before they can set off for the airport, a heavy snowfall traps the family and the staff at the farm for the entire festive season - just as two shady-looking characters arrive on the scene. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivan's sitcom from 2006. Jed, Elgin and Bryan become convinced a mythical creature is stalking Winterdown Farm, and Llewellyn accuses the Boyces' dog of seducing his pedigree collie. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives' case against a violent criminal is thrown into jeopardy by the murder of a key witness. Determined to secure a conviction, they immerse themselves in the seedy underworld of a seaside town, and as they press for answers, Havers is brought face to face with her childhood memories. Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces a dilemma when his friend Joey makes a dying wish, and the Knight family support Ajax and Meryl as they each confront a crisis.

programme.desc: Crooks realise Jim's investigations are bringing him dangerously close to nailing them - so they set out to undermine his credibility by driving him back to the bottle. John Nettles plays the Jersey-based detective.

programme.desc: Christmas edition of the Only Fools and Horses spin-off from 2007. Former Cheers actor George Wendt makes a guest appearance as a former GI who was billeted in the village during the 1970s, and has returned to find out whether he fathered any children during his stay. It does not take Marlene long to see what made him such a hit with the ladies, but Boycie proves harder to win over - until he discovers his unwanted guest is extremely wealthy. Sue Holderness and John Challis star.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo returns her entire Christmas order because the tree is too short - and she and Jerry are left with no means to celebrate after the department store fails to redeliver in time. Tom and Barbara come to the rescue, inviting them round for a Christmas of homemade paper hats and improvised party games. Seasonal special from 1977, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, Paul Eddington and Felicity Kendal.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo insists that Jerry keep fit so he will be well enough to enjoy his retirement when it comes. Tom realises he and Barbara have no money set aside for their old age and presents a bank manager with an unusual proposition. George Cole guest stars in the final episode of the sitcom, made for the 1978 Royal Command Performance.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate when young lawyer Emily Proctor is found axed to death in Hyde Park. They are led to the chambers of a human rights barrister who was having an affair with her, and it isn't long before the victim's seedy double life involving Internet porn and dark family secrets emerges. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Samuel West.

programme.desc: The detectives are asked to carry out a preliminary investigation into a corrupt senior officer who may have suppressed evidence when a notorious crime boss was put away for murdering a prominent doctor. However, Sasha feels torn because she is almost certain that eight years earlier the convict in question also killed her CID partner. Meanwhile, Steve gets a shock when his estranged son turns up at work to see him. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A suspected paedophile is found dead in a playground, so inexperienced detective Rory Drennan calls in Nikki and Jack to attend. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Claudie Blakley, Lorraine Burroughs and John Dagliesh.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh is facing his biggest crisis yet when his love life, career and family are all in desperate need of a help. Also, Charlie plays dirty to win back Matt.

programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth puts all her efforts into directing a pageant based on the Civil War, with herself as Queen Henrietta Maria and Richard as Charles I. Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.desc: Nick confesses to Dot that he murdered Eddie Royle. Dot calls the police and Nick gets taken away. The whole Square are waiting for news of Clyde.

programme.desc: Young Mr Grace instructs everyone to wear fancy dress in the run-up to Christmas, turning the departments into fairy-tale grottos. Festive edition of the department store comedy from 1975, with Harold Bennett, John Inman and Mollie Sugden.

programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A rising star in the Essex police force is found beaten and shot in his burnt-out car in what proves to be an emotional case for his colleagues. The team helps DCI Jim Sullivan, the detective charged with bringing the killer to justice, and it isn't long before suspicion falls on Dean Fallon - a local drug dealer and the son of a known crime boss. But when he proves to have a solid alibi, the investigation shifts closer to home. Starring Emilia Fox and David Caves, with James Alexandrou and Jason Watkins.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As all attempts to locate Abi Nixon prove fruitless, Sam begins to panic - could her daughter have been abducted, committed suicide or even faked her own death? Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny's sister causes havoc for Hugh and Ken when she visits Whyhope to defend Meryl against corruption charges. Betty uses her hidden talents to solve a medical mystery.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny makes a choice when Hugh and Toke turn up the romantic pressure. When Charlie is unfairly sacked by the Headmaster, Meryl resorts to blackmail to get her reinstated.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Christmas turns to misery for most of Blue Watch when Hallam is set on fire, Charisma discovers that Donna is selling dangerous toys, and Josie and Bayleaf end up in bed together.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Feature-length festive episode from 1992. A violent attack on an elderly Czech fighter pilot leads Lovejoy and Eric to hunt for missing diamonds in Prague, and the pair are soon joined by Jane, who was holidaying in Austria with friends. Meanwhile, Tinker is left to make preparations for Christmas. Guest starring Donald Pleasence, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: The Lady Vanishes
programme.desc: It is 1931 and socialite Iris Carr (Tuppence Middleton) is travelling back from a holiday in the Balkans, but faints on the platform of the railway station in the scorching heat. She is comforted by fellow passenger Miss Froy (Selina Cadell), but when Iris falls asleep she awakes to find the woman has disappeared and everyone else on board denies ever having seen her. With only handsome traveller Max Hare (Tom Hughes) for support, Iris maintains that Miss Froy has somehow been abducted - even though it increasingly appears to be a delusion on her part. Mystery, also starring Keeley Hawes, Gemma Jones, Stephanie Cole and Julian Rhind-Tutt. Adapted from Ethel Lina White's novel, The Wheel Spins.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Millionaire environmentalist and scientist Dan Hagen is shot on his boat while out at sea, and all the evidence points toward a robbery gone wrong, but DI Goodman suspects foul play by a crew member. The team soon realises the group are not as close-knit as they initially seem, and with everyone hiding a secret, the pressure is on to get to the bottom of how and why Dan was killed. The case gives the British detective a sudden desire to become a sailor, while Florence surprises the team with her action hero credentials. Caribbean crime drama, starring Kris Marshall and JosÃ©phine Jobert.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a DJ leads Nikki to question her judgement in a strikingly similar case from her past and she brings the potential mistake to the attention of her colleagues, but the news threatens to have repercussions for the family of the deceased, the police and the Lyell Centre. The fresh evidence leads to the conclusion that a copycat killer is at large and Nikki finds evidence that an intruder has been entering her home. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh struggles to prove his innocence and win back Penny after failing a drug test. Meryl and Charlie lock horns over Hayley's entry in the Miss Whyhope competition.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.
